title: Ferran Olivella
text:
Ferran Olivella Pons (born 22 June 1936) is a Spanish former <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a>, Olivella joined <a href="FC%20Barcelona">FC Barcelona</a>'s youth ranks at the age of 17. He started playing as a senior with neighbouring <a href="CD%20Condal">SD España Industrial</a> in <a href="Segunda%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Segunda División</a>, returning to the <a href="Camp%20Nou">Camp Nou</a> in 1956.
Olivella appeared in 509 competitive games during his spell with his main club, scoring 12 times. He won back-to-back <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a> championships from <a href="1958%E2%80%9359%20La%20Liga">1958</a> to <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20La%20Liga">1960</a>, his only goal as a professional occurring on 14 February 1960 in an 8–0 home demolition of <a href="UD%20Las%20Palmas">UD Las Palmas</a>.
International career.
Olivella earned 18 <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a> for the <a href="Spain%20national%20football%20team">Spain national team</a> in eight years. He made his debut on 31 March 1957, in a 5–0 <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> win against <a href="Belgium%20national%20football%20team">Belgium</a>.
Olivella acted as <a href="Captain%20%28association%20football%29">captain</a> when the country won the <a href="1964%20European%20Nations%27%20Cup">1964 European Nations' Cup</a>. He was also selected for the <a href="1966%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1966 FIFA World Cup</a> held in England, being an unused squad member in an eventual group stage exit.
